required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Ph1/2 Study of EMB-06 in Participants With Recurrent or Refractory Myeloma
clinical_study.official_title: A First-in-human, Phase I/II, Open-Label Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics and Preliminary Antitumor Activity of EMB-06 in Patients With Recurrent or Refractory Multiple Myeloma

brief_summary.textblock: The primary purpose of this study is to identify the recommended Phase 2 dose(s) (RP2Ds) and schedule assessed to be safe for EMB-06 and to characterize the safety and tolerability of EMB-06 at the RP2Ds. Pharmacokinetics (PK), immunogenicity, and the anti-multiple myeloma activity of EMB-06 will also be assessed.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a Phase I/II, multi-center, open label, multiple-dose, first in human study, designed to assess safety and tolerability, and to identify the maximum tolerated dose (MTD) and/or recommended Phase 2 dose (RP2D) for EMB-06 in patients with relapsed or refractory multiple myeloma. Pharmacokinetics, pharmacodynamics, immunogenicity, and response will also be assessed.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Dose escalation followed by Cohort Expansion Phase at the RP2D.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence and severity of adverse events
primary_outcome.time_frame: Screening up to follow-up (30 days after the last dose)
Screening up to follow-up (30 days after the last dose)
Screening up to follow-up (30 days after the last dose)
primary_outcome.description: Incidence of dose interruptions of EMB-06 during treatment as a measure of tolerability.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Screening up to follow-up (30 days after the last dose)
primary_outcome.description: Actual amount of drug taken by patients divided by the planned amount.

primary_outcome.measure: The incidence of DLTs during treatment.
primary_outcome.time_frame: First infusion to the end of Cycle 1 (each cycle is 28 days)
primary_outcome.description: The Dose Limiting Toxicities (DLTs) are based on drug related adverse events and are specifically defined in study protocol.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From the date of dosing until the date of first documented progression or date of death from any cause, whichever came first, expected average 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Measured by IMWG criteria, only applicable in Phase II part

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the serum concentration-time curve (AUC) of EMB-06.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through treatment until EOT visit, expected average 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples for serum PK analysis will be obtained (AUC).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through treatment until EOT visit, expected average 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples for serum PK analysis will be obtained (Cmax).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through treatment until EOT visit, expected average 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples for serum PK analysis will be obtained (Ctrough).

secondary_outcome.measure: Average concentration over a dosing interval (Css, avg) of EMB-06.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through treatment until EOT visit, expected average 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples for serum PK analysis will be obtained (Css, avg).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through treatment until EOT visit, expected average 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples for serum PK analysis will be obtained (T1/2).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through treatment until EOT visit, expected average 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples for serum PK analysis will be obtained (CL).

secondary_outcome.measure: Steady state volume of distribution (Vss) of EMB-06.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through treatment until EOT visit, expected average 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples for serum PK analysis will be obtained (Vss).

secondary_outcome.measure: Progression free survival (PFS) of EMB-06 as assessed by IMWG criteria.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the date of dosing until the date of first documented progression or date of death from any cause, whichever came first, expected average 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Preliminary anti-multiple myeloma activity of EMB-06 will be obtained (PFS).

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of response of EMB-06 as assessed by IMWG criteria
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the date of dosing until the date of first documented progression or date of death from any cause, whichever came first, expected average 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Preliminary anti-multiple myeloma activity of EMB-06 will be obtained (DOR).

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence and titer of anti-drug antibodies stimulated by EMB-06.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to End of Treatment Follow Up Period (30 days after the last dose)
secondary_outcome.description: Antibodies to EMB-06 will be assessed to evaluate potential immunogenicity.

arm_group.description: In Phase I part: participants enrolled at different time will receive EMB-06 once weekly (IV) at different ascending dose levels. In Phase II part: participants will receive EMB-06 once weekly (IV) at previously defined RP2D.

intervention.description: EMB-06 is a FIT-Ig® bispecific antibody against BCMA and CD3.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Willing and able to provide written informed consent.
- Patients who have been diagnosed with multiple myeloma according to IMWG diagnostic criteria 2014 and have relapsed or refractory multiple myeloma with at least one measurable lesion.
- The patient must have received at least two lines of prior antimyeloma therapies, including proteasome inhibitors- and immunomodulatory agents-based regimens.
- ECOG performance status 0 or 1 for phase I, and ≤2 for phase II.
- Adequate organ function and reasonable laboratory test results to participate in the trial.
- Highly effective contraception
Exclusion Criteria:
- Life expectancy is less than 3 months.
- Patient participated in any other clinical study within 1 month prior to enrollment in this clinical study.
- Patients with ongoing AE.
- Previously treated with any BCMA-targeted therapy.
- History of allogeneic stem cell transplantation.
- Previously treated with the following anti-tumor therapy (prior to first dosing of EMB-06)
1. Treated with monoclonal antibody for multiple myeloma within 28 days
2. Treated with proteasome inhibitors within 14 days
3. Treated with immunomodulatory agents within 14 days
4. Treated with cytotoxic therapy within 14 days
5. Received investigational drug within 28 days or at least 5 half-lives, whichever is shorter (if a, b, c, d not applicable)
6. Received radiotherapy within 21 days. Except that the radiation portal covered ≤ 5% of the bone marrow reserve, the patient will be eligible to participate in the study regardless of the end date of radiation therapy
7. Plasmapheresis within 7 days
- Patient received autologous stem cell transplantation within 12 weeks prior to the start of study treatment.
- Active or historically multiple myeloma related central nervous system involvement.
- Patients requiring high dose of systemic treatment with corticosteroids.
- Patients with active infections, including COVID-19, hepatitis, etc..
- History of severe allergic reactions
- Patients with severe or uncontrolled cardiovascular disorder requiring treatment
- Pre-existing other serious medical conditions

facility.name: Sunshine Coast Haematology and Oncology Clinic (SCHOC)
